Assalamu Alaikum! Hello everyone! Welcome to Taste of Chennai. Today we are going to see how to make the famous Ambur Mutton Biriyani at home.

I have taken Jeera Samba rice to make Ambur Mutton Biriyani. If you want, you can use Basmati rice too, but traditionally Jeera Samba rice is used. I’ve taken about 600 grams. You can adjust the quantity of mutton based on how much rice you’re using. I’ve taken 800 grams of mutton for 600 grams of rice. Take 100 grams of ginger garlic paste—that’s about 4-5 tablespoons.
